summary: This bill, the Sickle Cell Disease Comprehensive Care Act, aims to improve outpatient clinical care for individuals with sickle cell disease. It amends Title XIX of the Social Security Act to establish a demonstration project, allowing states to provide health home services. Key provisions include requiring dental and vision services for eligible individuals, mandating state reports, and requiring the Secretary to publish best practices. The bill defines eligible individuals and sickle cell disease, outlining eligibility and genetic testing requirements.
